snippet: Officials cited voter fraud, improper interference and fistfights between election commissioners, but the opposition, which had claimed victory, suggested that it was being robbed.

byline.contributor: Willy Lowry contributed reporting from Arusha, Tanzania, and Orton Kiishweko from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.

abstract: Troubled elections extend into its third day on Tanzanian island of Zanzibar, where main opposition party has called for recount and fears of unrest are mounting.
lead_paragraph: Officials cited voter fraud, improper interference and fistfights between election commissioners, but the opposition, which had claimed victory, suggested that it was being robbed.

headline.print_headline: Election Unrest Feared on Tanzanian Island
headline.main: Unrest Feared as Zanzibar Local Elections Are Annulled
